results.title: Buddhism: the middle way of compassion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Religions of the world”.
A compassionate view of life, Buddhism has had a profound influence on the philosophical and political development of the nations of Asia. People in the West are becoming increasingly attracted to Buddhism and there are over 250 million followers. This episode looks at the life of the Buddha and at different types of Buddhist beliefs.

results.title: Ancient religions of the Mediterranean
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
This documentary turns its focus back into history to examine the diverse spiritual traditions of ancient Mediterranean cultures, and offer insight as to how the rituals and belief systems of these societies may have influenced modern religions such as Christianity, Islam and Judaism. Humanity’s basic desire to co-exist in harmony with the natural world was one of the primary factors involved with the increasing worship and deification of animal spirits. Agricultural advances saw wild animals - and therefore, wild spirits - being simultaneously domesticated. Gods and goddesses portrayed in a more accessible human form, or in a human form merged with that of an animal, grew in popularity. From Mesopotamia and Egypt to the Greek and Roman empires, different forms of worship, underpinned by similar archetypal myths and images, flourished and expanded. Narrated by Ben Kingsley. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Wheatlands of East Anglia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Regional Geography”.
The first part of this film deals with the conditions which make East Anglia a good wheat-growing area, and shows both large-scale and small-scale methods of wheat-growing in England, the second part of the film deals with marketing and distribution.

results.title: Lancashire
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Regional Geography”.
Traces the rise of industrial Lancashire, and notes the importance of the coastal ports in the growth of new industries. Also deals with Lancashire’s agriculture, recreation and housing.

results.title: The Fenlands
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Regional Geography”.
The Fenlands situated in Eastern England are one of the flattest regions of Britain. The Fenland landscape is almost wholly manmade, being the result of draining the land, to make it available for agriculture. The danger of flooding is ever present, and in 1947 a disastrous flood occurred. In an attempt to overcome the problem, an extensive sluice system has been devised.

results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Design and operation of the bellows type and the diaphragm type automatic expansion valves, and how to adjust, check and service the bellows type valve.

results.title: Adjusting and repairing the thermo expansion valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the theory of multiple commercial refrigeration systems, how to test and adjust the thermo-expansion valve, recognize symptoms of trouble with the valve and repair it.

results.title: Removing or installing a compressor or condenser
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Common cooling unit disorders in a domestic refrigerator; how to evacuate valved evaporators; remove an oil-logged evaporator; install the evaporator; and install a direct expansion cooling unit.
